intro: Kurrimia macrophylla, commonly known as the broad-leaf kurrimia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil. Kurrimia macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a shade plant.
